questions.question_text_1: In a J-K flipflop, when J = 1 and K = 1, it toggles the flipflop’s state.
question_texts: In a J-K flipflop, when J = 1 and K = 1, it toggles the flipflop’s state.

questions.question_text_1: A multiplexer is a digital circuit that selects one of several input signals and forwards it to a single output line.
question_texts: A multiplexer is a digital circuit that selects one of several input signals and forwards it to a single output line.

questions.question_text_1: In a NAND-based gated D latch, when the write enable input is 1, it denotes the Memory Hold state.
question_texts: In a NAND-based gated D latch, when the write enable input is 1, it denotes the Memory Hold state.

questions.question_text_1: In a positive-edge-triggered D flipflop, if the D input is 1 and the clock signal transitions from low to high, Q output is 0.
question_texts: In a positive-edge-triggered D flipflop, if the D input is 1 and the clock signal transitions from low to high, Q output is 0.

questions.question_text_1: Sequential circuits utilize feedback loops, while combinational circuits do not.
question_texts: Sequential circuits utilize feedback loops, while combinational circuits do not.

questions.question_text_1: Consider a gated D-Latch constructed using NAND gates. The initial input (at 0 ns) is D = 1, and the write enable is high. The write enable toggles between high and low every 5 ns. The input D changes from 0 to 1 and from 1 to 0 every 6 seconds. What will be the output Q after 16 ns?
question_texts: Consider a gated D-Latch constructed using NAND gates. The initial input (at 0 ns) is D = 1, and the write enable is high. The write enable toggles between high and low every 5 ns. The input D changes from 0 to 1 and from 1 to 0 every 6 seconds. What will be the output Q after 16 ns?

questions.question_text_1: Consider the circuit consisting of three D flipflops and one NAND gate as shown below.The initial states are Q1=1, Q2=0, and Q3=1. What is the output (Q1,Q2,Q3) after 4 clock pulses?
